byline.original: By HUGH BYAS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Japanese note to Craigie demands return of 21 German seamen; Arita sees settlement soon; London repts compromise formula agreed to
snippet: TOKYO, Feb. 1--Japan formally demanded tonight that Britain return the twenty-one German seamen removed from the liner Asama Maru. The demand was made in a note handed to Sir Robert Leslie Craigie, the British Ambassador....

headline.main: JAPANESE DEMAND BRITISH FREE NAZIS; Note Precedes Efforts to Settle Issue of 21 Seamen--Food Curb at Tientsin Eased

lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Feb. 1--Japan formally demanded tonight that Britain return the twenty-one German seamen removed from the liner Asama Maru. The demand was made in a note handed to Sir Robert Leslie Craigie, the British Ambassador.
